intro: Acourtia sinaloana, commonly known as the Sinaloa acourtia, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. Its flowers are usually yellow or white, and it produces small, oval-shaped fruits. Acourtia sinaloana is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological adaptations.
